template.p: The Recruitment app provides a central hub for managing three core areas:

li.p: Job Positions: Define your requirements, website listings, and necessary skills.
Talent Pools: Maintain a database of qualified candidates ready for future roles.
Applicants: Track active candidates through the recruitment pipeline for each job position.

template.p: Job positions can be pre-populated through the CRM process. To maximize the app's effectiveness, it is important to understand these key settings:

li.p: Draft: Used for job position awaiting final client approval. You cannot publish these or add applicants yet.
Open: Active roles that are ready for publication.
Done: Fulfilled or inactive job position; these are hidden from the website and automatically filtered out of your main view.
Recruitment Type: Distinguish between Internal (hiring for your own firm) and External (hiring on behalf of a client).
External Settings: For client-based job positions, you can designate the Customer and the Hiring Team Contact. Members of the Hiring Team Contact will receive emails whenever new CVs are submitted.
Website Integration: Once a position is set to "Open," ensure the public listing is formatted correctly for your website.
Target: It specifies the total number of positions for this job. Each successful hire automatically reduces the remaining target count by one.

template.p: Talent Pools allow you to categorize and nurture potential candidates outside of specific vacancies. You can build these pools manually or by sourcing standout applicants from existing job positions. Once a candidate is in a pool, they become a "Talent" who can be easily matched to multiple job positions.

li.p: Seamless Application: When a Talent is moved to a job position, the system creates a linked duplicate for that specific role, ensuring organized record-keeping.

Smart Syncing: Most data is shared between the Talent profile and their specific job applications. For example, updating a candidate's availability in the Talent Pool automatically updates it across all their active applications.
Independent Pipelines: While core information is linked, each application follows its own unique recruitment journey, allowing you to track progress for different roles simultaneously.
Submit an Entry: Go to the website and apply for the Open Application job.
Locate the Candidate: Find the new application within that Job Position in the back-end.
Add to Pool: Select the application and click the Add to Pool button.
Convert to Talent: The candidate is now a "Talent." From their profile, you can now instantly apply them to any other open positions.

template.p: Our system offers a flexible architecture for managing candidates. You can source applicants through three primary channels:

li.p: Talent Pool: Promoting an existing talent record using the "Apply Job" button.
Website Integration: Direct applications from your website‚Äôs job board.
Manual Entry: Creating a record directly within the specific Job Position pipeline.
Availability Tracking: For every applicant, you can toggle their status (Available/Unavailable) or set a specific "Available From" date.
Internal Files: Documents attached to the Chatter are private and for internal use only.
Shared Files: Documents uploaded to the Shared CV field are customer-facing. These are the files sent via email to clients and published on the Customer Portal.
Automation: Each pipeline stage can be configured to send automated emails to maintain consistent communication with candidates.
Scheduling: Ensure your Appointment app is synced to allow candidates to book meetings based on your real-time availability.

template.p: Candidates enter the pipeline via the website, manual entry, or by being moved from the Talent pool into a specific job pipe.

The Customer Portal: Clients can log into their Odoo portal to view their Sales Orders, Invoices, and the Applications you have shared from the previous report.

Real-Time Synchronization: This centralized view ensures that if you update a candidate‚Äôs availability (e.g., they are hired elsewhere), that status updates instantly across all client portals where that CV was shared.
